  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    firstOperation()
    Method to get the maximum possible number of tiles that can be selected from the board Calls the view to ask the payer about how many tiles the player wants to retrieve
    void
    firstTurnStarter()
    Method used to initialize the parameters of the game, called before the firs turn of the game Calls the view in order to display the initial board and the cards that have been extracted randomly
    void

    Method that gets from the view the column that the player wants to put his chosen tiles and in which order he wants the tiles to be.

    void
    getFromViewNTiles(User user, int chosenNumber)
    Gets from the view the number of tiles that the current player wants to retrieve from the board The method also sends to the view the list of lists of tiles that the user can choose in order to highlight them on the board.

    getTilesListFromView(User user, List<Tile> chosenList)
    Method to get the list of tiles the user has selected from the board, The method also sends to the view the list of 'empty-enough' columns in which the chosen tiles might be put in.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(Game game, Lobby lobbyIn)
      Constructor method
      Parameters:
      game - is the game which this controller references to
      lobbyIn - is the reference to the external lobby

  • Method Details

    • firstOperation

      public void firstOperation()
      Method to get the maximum possible number of tiles that can be selected from the board Calls the view to ask the payer about how many tiles the player wants to retrieve

    • getFromViewNTiles

      public void getFromViewNTiles(User user, int chosenNumber) throws WrongTurnException, WrongListException, IndexOutOfBoundsException, RemoteException
      Gets from the view the number of tiles that the current player wants to retrieve from the board The method also sends to the view the list of lists of tiles that the user can choose in order to highlight them on the board.
      Parameters:
      chosenNumber - is the input from the user
      Throws:
      WrongTurnException
      WrongListException
      IndexOutOfBoundsException
      RemoteException

    • getTilesListFromView

      public void getTilesListFromView(User user, List<Tile> chosenList) throws WrongPlayerException
      Method to get the list of tiles the user has selected from the board, The method also sends to the view the list of 'empty-enough' columns in which the chosen tiles might be put in.
      Parameters:
      chosenList - is the list of selected tiles
      Throws:
      InvalidTileException - exception used when a wrong tile is selected
      WrongPlayerException

    • getColumnFromView

      public void getColumnFromView(User user, int col, List<Tile> orderedTiles) throws InvalidIDException
      Method that gets from the view the column that the player wants to put his chosen tiles and in which order he wants the tiles to be. The method also calls the view to display the new points acquired by the player
      Parameters:
      col - is the column of the shelfie where to put the tiles in
      orderedTiles - is the list of chosen tiles, ordered as the player wants them to be in his shelfie
      Throws:
      InvalidTileException - exception used when a wrong tile is selected
      InvalidIDException

    • firstTurnStarter

      public void firstTurnStarter()
      Method used to initialize the parameters of the game, called before the firs turn of the game Calls the view in order to display the initial board and the cards that have been extracted randomly

    • getGame

      public Game getGame()
      Getter method
      Returns:
      the reference to the game controlled by this GameController
